content.raw:
I managed to fix the vertical distortion that was still in the point cloud. Now I think the result looks correct, I tested a couple of different settings for vertical/horizontal vield of view and samples and the results looked always good. Would be very nice if either @iche033 or @JChoclin could test it as well (repository linked above).

One thing I ignored for now is the interpolation and the resolution parameter (set it to 1). So this won't work yet I think. Wouldn't it generally make sense to get rid of the manual interpolation [done in GpuRaySensor.cc](https://bitbucket.org/enwaytech/gazebo/src/107e951cdbf5c1b956b4883a5f565cc707d45b33/gazebo/sensors/GpuRaySensor.cc#lines-699) and just increase the resolution of the first pass rendering accordingly?
